column4: anyone? can some1 pastebin the content of google.xml and wikipedia.xml?
ah, i don't use gnome-shell, sorry
that's cos most things i've found online suggest using Foxit reader throught wine, cos the linuxy version is buggy
what pdf viewers have you tried?
foxit for linux, evince, okular, xpdfepdfviewer
how do u activate tabs on evince?
just open another PDF in it and it should work
I'm doing that, and it just opens more and more windows...
seems its just an idea: http://brainstorm.ubuntu.com/item/15899/
yes, i've seen that request :) any other ideas?
have you tried the adobe PDF reader?
i've tried it, but i am looking for something more OS and less proprietary :) also it's bulky and convoluted in my opinion, that's why i like evince
surely its sleeker than wine + windows app.....
i agree :) that's why i was looking for something more lightweight like evince, just that supports tabs
I believe the text in the .desktop file in /usr/share/applications dictates that stuff
